title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in the Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, and Uva provinces, and in the Ampara district after 2.00 p.m.

title: No Laugfs Gas price revision in November
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC has confirmed that there will be no price revision for domestic gas cylinder refills in the month of November, 2025.

title: Suspect wanted for shooting arrested in Hingurana
byline: A suspect wanted in connection with a shooting incident that injured a person has been arrested with 13 grams of heroin during a raid conducted by officers attached to the Moratuwa Police Special Task Force (STF) Camp yesterday (31).

title: 6.0-magnitude quake hits southeast Indian Ridge – USGS
byline: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.0 jolted southeast Indian Ridge at 2053 GMT on Friday, the U.S. Geological Survey said.

title: Speaker endorses Personal Data Protection (Amendment) Bill
byline: The Speaker, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, endorsed the certificate on the Personal Data Protection (Amendment) Bill on 30 October 2025.

title: Fee to be charged for polythene bags with handles from today
byline: With effect from today (01), traders are required to charge consumers for plastic shopping bags with handles, commonly referred to as “sili-sili bags.”

title: Tourist arrivals in October top 150,000
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) reports that a total of 153,063 tourists visited the country between 1 and 29 October 2025.

title: Tuition classes targeting 2025 A/L exam prohibited from Nov. 04
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that tuition classes, lectures, and seminars related to the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will be prohibited from midnight on November 4.

title: Agency director arrested for Rs. 740 mln Romania job scam
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested a director of a foreign employment agency in Maharagama for allegedly defrauding over Rs. 740 million from individuals by promising employment opportunities in Romania.

title: Three-wheeler fares will not be revised without proper regulation – Union
byline: The All-Island Three-Wheeler Drivers’ Union states that there will be no revision of fares despite the recent fuel price reduction, unless a proper regulatory mechanism is implemented.

title: 6 arrested with fishing vessel over drug-related activities off Western Coast
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has taken six individuals into custody, along with their multi-day fishing vessel, in the deep seas off the western coast on suspicion of drug-related activities.

title: Egypt’s Grand Museum opens, displaying Tutankhamun tomb in full for first time
byline: Near one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World - the Great Pyramid of Khufu at Giza - Egypt is officially opening what it intends as a cultural highlight of the modern age.

title: At least 9 killed in stampede at Venkateswara temple in India’s Andhra Pradesh
byline: At least nine devotees, most of them women and children, have died in a stampede at a temple in Andhra Pradesh’s Srikakulam early this morning.

title: NASA responds to Kim Kardashian claiming moon landing ‘was fake’
byline: In a testament to Kim Kardashian’s power to grab the spotlight, the head of NASA felt compelled this week to set the record straight when the reality TV queen said she believed a well-worn conspiracy theory that the 1969 Apollo 11 moon landing was a fake.

title: Woman who obstructed police officers on duty remanded
byline: The woman seen in a video widely circulating on social media, obstructing and verbally abusing police officers on traffic duty in the Udugampola area, has been remanded until November 3.

title: China’s Shenzhou 21 docks with space station, sets the country’s own speed record
byline: China announced Saturday that its Shenzhou 21 spaceship docked with China’s space station with its latest three rotation crew at the country’s own record speed after a successful launch.

title: Weak governance led to regime change in Bangladesh, Nepal, Sri Lanka - India’s NSA
byline: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval said on Friday that governance plays a seminal role in nation-building and in securing a nation, enabling it to achieve its goals and fulfil the aspirations of the common man.

title: Nearly 5kg of cocaine seized from woman arriving from Colombo in Mumbai
byline: DRI officers have seized 4.7 kg of cocaine worth about INR 4.7 million from a female passenger arriving from Colombo at the Mumbai airport and arrested five persons, the finance ministry said on Saturday.

title: Tanzania opposition says hundreds killed in vote protests, UN calls for probe
byline: Tanzania’s main opposition party said on Friday hundreds of people had been killed in protests over elections this week, as the U.N. secretary-general called for an investigation into allegations of excessive use of force.

title: Weligama PS chairman murder: Motorcycle used in shooting found abandoned
byline: The motorcycle used by the assailants in the assassination of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickremasekara has been recovered abandoned in a forested area along the Buttala-Kataragama Road.

title: Weak governance led to regime change in Bangladesh, Nepal, Sri Lanka - Indias NSA
byline: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval said on Friday that governance plays a seminal role in nation-building and in securing a nation, enabling it to achieve its goals and fulfil the aspirations of the common man.

title: Businessman arrested with pistol and ammunition in Minuwangoda
byline: A businessman residing in a housing complex in Minuwangoda has been arrested by police for the possession of a pistol and several bullets.

title: State revenue up in first half of 2025 compared to previous year
byline: A significant increase in total government revenue excluding grants has been recorded during the first half of 2025, compared to the same period of 2024, according to a latest report released by the Ministry of Finance.

title: Suspect wanted over shooting and attempted murder arrested
byline: A suspect wanted in connection with an attempted murder involving a shooting incident in the Hirana area has been arrested by officers attached to the Moratuwa Police Special Task Force (STF) camp.

title: Around 20 MPs request firearms citing security concerns?
byline: Around twenty Members of Parliament (MPs) have requested for the issuance of firearms for their personal security, according to parliamentary sources.

title: Minister Vijitha Herath says Tourism Act will be amended
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath says that steps will be taken to amend the Tourism Act in order to achieve rapid growth in the tourism industry.

title: Tanzanian president wins disputed election with more than 97% of votes
byline: Tanzania President Samia Suluhu Hassan was declared on Saturday the landslide winner of an election that set off deadly protests across the country this week over the exclusion of her main challengers.
